title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 §§ 635-12.5 - Billing, collection and assignment of unpaid amounts

N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 §§ 635-12.5 - Billing, collection and assignment of unpaid amounts

State Regulations
(a) This section applies to all services, whether or not they are preexisting services. (b) If the individual does not have full

Medicaid coverage, the provider shall bill the individual and/or other liable
parties for the services in accordance with the applicable fee schedule in
section
635-12.9
of this Subpart or with
the reduced fee established by the provider with the approval of OPWDD. However, if the fee has been waived by the provider with the approval of OPWDD, the provider is not required to bill the individual or other liable parties for
the Service. (c) The provider must
present the bill no later than 30 days after the month in which the provider
rendered the services. (d) The
provider shall make reasonable efforts to collect unpaid bills. (e) Collection efforts cannot interfere with
the individual's services. (f) After making reasonable collection efforts and upon consent of OPWDD, a
provider shall assign to OPWDD its claim for payment for any unpaid
amount. (g) Any payments received
by the State for unpaid claims assigned pursuant to this section shall be paid
to the provider, minus any State funds paid to the provider pursuant to section
635-12.8
of this

Subpart. Notes
